entry.title: Margery Jackson (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Carlisle miser Margery Jackson, who chose to live like a pauper, possessed a fine court mantua (pictured)?

entry.title: The Steranko History of Comics (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that The Steranko History of Comics has been described as the first piece of cultural analysis on American comic books?

entry.title: Heinz Schwarz (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Heinz Schwarz attended all CDU party conventions from the first ever in 1950 to 2020?

entry.title: Ionia Volcano (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the Lewis and Clark Expedition documented the Ionia Volcano?

entry.title: Jake Witt (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that although he only had ten minutes to learn to play offensive lineman, college football player Jake Witt was able to successfully block against "the best defensive line" in the U.S.?

entry.title: N53 road (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the Irish N53 road from Dundalk to Castleblayney has a 6-kilometre (3.7 mi) gap where it enters Northern Ireland?

entry.title: Karmalink (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Cambodia's first science-fiction film, Karmalink, combines Buddhist concepts of karma with themes of artificial intelligence?

entry.title: Émile Aubrun (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Émile Aubrun flew circles around a golden virgin?
